meanings.definition: To turn or pivot on a swivel.
meanings.sent1: She was swiveling in her chair to see the view outside.
meanings.sent2: The mechanic was swiveling the chair to reach the tools behind him.
meanings.sent3: The cat was swiveling its head curiously to follow the bird's flight.
meanings.sent4: The dancer was swiveling gracefully on the stage, captivating the audience.
meanings.sent5: The owl's head was swiveling silently, scanning the dark forest for prey.

meanings.definition: The act of rotating or turning on a swivel.
meanings.sent1: The swiveling of the door allowed for easy access to the room.
meanings.sent2: The constant swiveling of the chair's base made it durable.
meanings.sent3: The swiveling of the globe revealed different countries to the students.
meanings.sent4: The swiveling of the lighthouse beacon guided ships safely to shore.
meanings.sent5: The swiveling of the camera captured every angle of the action-packed scene.
